body:
Can confirm that this is a bug. The two extensions are assigned the prefixes `_main~my_ext~` and `_main~my_ext~2~` now, which is bad since the former is a prefix of the latter.

I am working on a fix.

CC @Wyverald

issue.title: Ensure that extension unique names followed by `~` are prefix-free

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Fixes errors such as the following when a module provides two extensions that share a name:

```
ERROR: /my/workspace/library_path/BUILD:4:13: no such package '@_main~my_ext~2~xyz//':
The repository '@_main~my_ext~2~xyz' could not be resolved:
Repository '@_main~my_ext~2~xyz' is not defined and referenced by '//library_path:library_name'
ERROR: Analysis of target '//my_path:my_target' failed; build aborted:
```

This was a consequence of the extension unique names followed by `~` being

```
_main~my_ext~2~
_main~my_ext~
```

since 19a971089952e53bba130a8e3e8b28b6b1e310e6. Before, they were of the following form, which was prefix-free:

```
_main~my_ext2~
_main~my_ext~
```

Fixes #19155

issue.title: [6.4.0] same `module_extension` name in different bzl files could not be resolved while using bzlmod in bazel 6.3.1

milestone.title: 6.4.0 release blockers
milestone.description: Issues that need to be resolved before the 6.4.0 release.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

body: @iancha1992 This is a regression from Bazel 6.2.0, so unfortunately we may need a 6.3.2 release to cherry-pick this into.
